org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.support
Class AeEventHandlersContainer

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.AeAbstractBpelObject
      org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.support.AeEventHandlersContainer
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeBpelObject, IAeEventParent, IAeExecutableBpelObject, IAeExecutableQueueItem, IAeFunctionFactory, IAeLocatableObject, IAeNamespaceContext, IAeVisitable
public class AeEventHandlersContainer
extends AeAbstractBpelObject
implements IAeEventParent

Models the eventHandlers in a scope activity.

completeEvents

public void completeEvents()
                    throws AeBusinessProcessException
Disables all of the events (alarms/messages) within this container. This will prevent them from becoming active and allow the scope to complete. If the event is already active, there is no change, the scope will need to wait for the events to complete.

Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

checkForActiveEvents

private void checkForActiveEvents()
                           throws AeBusinessProcessException
Scans the messages and alarms looking for any active events. If there are none then the parent scope is notified that there are no more events to wait for.

Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

eventsCompleted

protected void eventsCompleted()
                        throws AeBusinessProcessException
Notifies the scope that our events have completed.

Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

noActiveEvents

private boolean noActiveEvents(java.util.Iterator aIterator)
Returns true if there are NO active events in the iterator.

Parameters:
aIterator -
Returns:
true if all of the events are INACTIVE. False if there is at least 1 active event.

disableEvents

private void disableEvents(java.util.Iterator aIterator)

childComplete

public void childComplete(IAeBpelObject aChild)
                   throws AeBusinessProcessException
Called by the engine when a message or alarm has finished executing. If the scope is waiting for us then we need to walk the events and see if there are any left to complete.

Specified by:
childComplete in interface IAeExecutableBpelObject
Overrides:
childComplete in class AeAbstractBpelObject
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

getChildrenForStateChange

public java.util.Iterator getChildrenForStateChange()
Description copied from interface: IAeBpelObject
Returns an Iterator for the bpel object's child objects which participate in the state change propagation. For structured activities, this merely returns an Iterator for the child activity or activities. In some cases though, like Scope, we're returning objects in addition to the single child activity. This is because scope needs to propagate the

Specified by:
getChildrenForStateChange in interface IAeBpelObject
Returns:
Iterator containing IAeBpelObjets
See Also:
IAeBpelObject.getChildrenForStateChange()
